title: The 2015 SPRING CLASSIC
body_text:
Warm, sunny weather, an impressive turnout, plenty of non-stop action, and a spectacular match -
welcome to SPRING CLASSIC '15.
Super spectator Robert Knott,
ECDElitist
Melissa Kerr, and The Writer's right-hand man John Tronolone formed armies by randomly picking names from the expensive fedora of one Joey Smalls. Although initially concerned with the specific team selections, the nail-biting games and close score put those worries to rest - - -
Team ONE was comprised of Edwards, Katz, K. Adams, Megill, Wolf, Stopa, and Fitzpatrick.
The rivaling team TWO was made up of Tronolone, Pierce, Smalls, Singh, Kerr, and Sputz.
Don't forget about the reinforcements: Nate Reynolds, Bryan Ruiz, Alison Bertsch, Steve Adams, Joe Sciarrino, Arthur Casbarro, Tyler Washington, Stacey Shipman, and Diana DiBuccio.
Game-by-Game Results
♦ Team ONE: Games 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 9, 11*
♦ Team TWO: Games 1, 5, 6, 10*, 12*
* = Prison Ball
The grueling sixth round resulted in a deadlocked 3-3 tie; ONE rebounded with a 3-round win streak to successfully capture the classic rules war. Team TWO gained some revenge by taking 2 of the 3 prison ball confrontations, but the night's overall score read 7-5 in favor of the '
#1s
'.
HIT THE RIM!
After 12 body-bruising rounds, SPRING CLASSIC '15 came to a close with an impromptu, night-concluding
Rimshot Contest
. It didn't take long for
Tyler Washington
to smack the regeneration target with authority and eventually claim the record-breaking victory. He defeated a slew of battle-tested performers: Joey Smalls, Zach Katz*, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Melissa Kerr, John Tronolone*, Nate Reynolds, Lauren Stopa*, Bryan Ruiz, Diana DiBuccio*, Arthur Casbarro, Michael Edwards, M. Sputz Krott*, Justin Wolf*, and runner-up, Justin Pierce*.
* = former champion.
STATS & RECORDS
♦ SPRING CLASSIC '15 was the 203rd ECD extravaganza and the third reunion since DODGEBOWL 200 in August 2013.
♦ Attendance ~ 22 (17 men, 5 women). There 13 members of the
ECDElite
Hall of Fame competing as well.
♦ New ECD Players ~ 4 (Bryan Ruiz, Joe Sciarrino, Supreet Singh, Tyler Washington). Thanks to their participation, the total number of players has climbed to 523.
CONGRATULATIONS!
♦
ECDElitist
,
Alison Bertsch
, competed in her 100th ECD event. She became just the 3rd woman (DiBuccio, Stopa) and 13th individual overall to reach this incredible milestone.
♦ The 20th Rimshot Contest was won by event newbie Tyler Washington. In doing so, he became the
youngest champion
to win
any
of the secondary games - Rimshot Contest, Battle Royal, Championship Chase, etc. - at just 12 years-old. The previous record was held by Kayla Knott, then 17, at ECD 185:
Anniversary 6
in September 2011.
________________________________________
____________________________
ECD10.
A Decade of Dodgeball hits August 22, 2015.
body_html:
Warm, sunny weather, an impressive turnout, plenty of non-stop action, and a spectacular match -
welcome to SPRING CLASSIC '15.

Super spectator Robert Knott, ECDElitist Melissa Kerr, and The Writer's right-hand man John Tronolone formed armies by randomly picking names from the expensive fedora of one Joey Smalls. Although initially concerned with the specific team selections, the nail-biting games and close score put those worries to rest - - -

Team ONE was comprised of Edwards, Katz, K. Adams, Megill, Wolf, Stopa, and Fitzpatrick.
The rivaling team TWO was made up of Tronolone, Pierce, Smalls, Singh, Kerr, and Sputz.

Don't forget about the reinforcements: Nate Reynolds, Bryan Ruiz, Alison Bertsch, Steve Adams, Joe Sciarrino, Arthur Casbarro, Tyler Washington, Stacey Shipman, and Diana DiBuccio.

Game-by-Game Results
♦ Team ONE: Games 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 9, 11*
♦ Team TWO: Games 1, 5, 6, 10*, 12*
* = Prison Ball

The grueling sixth round resulted in a deadlocked 3-3 tie; ONE rebounded with a 3-round win streak to successfully capture the classic rules war. Team TWO gained some revenge by taking 2 of the 3 prison ball confrontations, but the night's overall score read 7-5 in favor of the '#1s'.

HIT THE RIM!
After 12 body-bruising rounds, SPRING CLASSIC '15 came to a close with an impromptu, night-concluding Rimshot Contest. It didn't take long for Tyler Washington to smack the regeneration target with authority and eventually claim the record-breaking victory. He defeated a slew of battle-tested performers: Joey Smalls, Zach Katz*, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Melissa Kerr, John Tronolone*, Nate Reynolds, Lauren Stopa*, Bryan Ruiz, Diana DiBuccio*, Arthur Casbarro, Michael Edwards, M. Sputz Krott*, Justin Wolf*, and runner-up, Justin Pierce*.
* = former champion.

STATS & RECORDS
♦ SPRING CLASSIC '15 was the 203rd ECD extravaganza and the third reunion since DODGEBOWL 200 in August 2013.
♦ Attendance ~ 22 (17 men, 5 women). There 13 members of the ECDElite Hall of Fame competing as well.
♦ New ECD Players ~ 4 (Bryan Ruiz, Joe Sciarrino, Supreet Singh, Tyler Washington). Thanks to their participation, the total number of players has climbed to 523.

CONGRATULATIONS!
♦ ECDElitist, Alison Bertsch, competed in her 100th ECD event. She became just the 3rd woman (DiBuccio, Stopa) and 13th individual overall to reach this incredible milestone.
♦ The 20th Rimshot Contest was won by event newbie Tyler Washington. In doing so, he became the youngest champion to win any of the secondary games - Rimshot Contest, Battle Royal, Championship Chase, etc. - at just 12 years-old. The previous record was held by Kayla Knott, then 17, at ECD 185: Anniversary 6 in September 2011.

____________________________________________________________________

ECD10.
A Decade of Dodgeball hits August 22, 2015.
